StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Mentored Patient Oriented Research in Lymphoma

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF TX MD ANDERSON CAN CTREMORY UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
Sources of support: • Supported by the Burroughs Wellcome Research Fund • V Foundation • National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health under award number K24 CA208132. • Winship Research Informatics shared resource of Winship Cancer Institute of Emory University National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health under award number P30CA138292. • The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health.
Collaborators: • Jean L. Koff has received grants from the V Foundation for work performed as part of the current study. • R. Andrew Harkins was supported in part by the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences of the National Institutes of Health under award numbers UL1TR002378 and TL1TR002382 for work performed as part of the current study. • Christopher R. Flowers has received grants from the National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health (K24 CA208132) for work performed as part of the current study • Michelle J. Lee and Christopher R. Flowers designed and performed the research. • C. Ileen Jhaney contributed to running analytical tools. All authors analyzed the data and wrote and edited the article.
Citation: Reddy A, Zhang J, Davis NS, et al. Genetic and functional drivers of diffuse large B cell lymphoma. Cell. 2017;171:481-494.e15.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-DLBCL-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
